text: The Coalition for Global Prosperity is a London-based not-for-profit campaign group which brings together community, political, military, and faith leaders in support of Great Britain’s role in international aid and development. ==Origin and focus== The Coalition for Global Prosperity (CGP) was founded by Conservative MP Theo Clarke in 2017. The group promotes the image of Britain as still having a significant leading role to play in international aid and development with the motto “Britain as a force for good” in the world.CGP website, https://www.coalitionforglobalprosperity.com/ retrieved 10 May 2020 The group calls for “a strong aid budget and an active diplomatic and defence strategy.”Peter Madeley, Express & Star, 26 September 2019, https://www.expressandstar.com/news/politics/2019/09/26/tories-select- election-candidate-to-replace-jeremy-lefroy-in-stafford/ retrieved 10 May 2020 When the 2019 United Nations’ Sustainable Development Goals Progress Report revealed that no country was on track to achieve the Global Goals by 2030, the all-party parliamentary group for UN Global Goals met with the CGP and other agencies in Westminster, to identify ways that business and government might step up the efforts to deliver on the Global Goals in the Decade of Action.Lord McConnell of Glenscorrodale, The Sunday Times, Monday 24 February 2020, https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/business-can-do-more-to-help-achieve- global-goals-on-sustainability-276t76l2t retrieved 10 May 2020 ==Supporters== A wide range of prominent individuals pledge their support for the Coalition, such as Bill GatesKirsty Weakley, Civil Society News, 5 October 2017, https://www.civilsociety.co.uk/news/charities-should-get-core-funding-from- members-not-government-tory-conference-hears.html retrieved 10 May 2020 and Gordon BrownGordon Brown, Korea Times 18 December 2019, http://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/opinion/2019/12/197_280500.html retrieved 10 May 2020 as well as Theresa May, Jonathan Sacks and Lenny Henry, all of whom appear on the CGP website. ==References== Category:Non-profit organisations based in London
